newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Pacific Andes offers 61.25 million shares.
newsitem.headline: Pacific Andes offers 61.25 million shares.

text.p: Pacific Andes Holdings Ltd said on Wednesday it was offering 61.25 million shares at US$0.57 each in its Singapore initial public offer.
A company statement said the initial public offer (IPO), lead managed by United Overseas Bank Ltd, comprised an equal portion of new and vendor shares.
Pacific Andes, owned by Hong Kong's Pacific Andes International Holdings, will be placing out 42.9 million shares and offer 18.4 million shares in its public tranche.
The group trades in frozen seafood products and related businesses.
The price of the shares is based on a historical price earnings ratio of 9.2 times.
For the financial year ended March 31 1996, the group announced net profits of Hong Kong $58.79 million on a turnover of HK$787.26 million.
The company statement said the net proceeds of the IPO, US$16.5 million, would be used to repay group borrowings and strengthen its working capital for future expansion.

"The group intends to establish a base in Singapore through which it can diversify its sourcing areas to cover the Indian Ocean and South Asian waters. The Singapore base will also manage the group's ship chartering and agency operations in the region," it said.
